body.p: Incoming calls on the SIP trunks can ring a Main Business Number.

note.p: This page is shown only if you select SIP Trunking as Yes.

li.p: Main Business Number: Enter the phone number of the site. External callers dial this number to place incoming calls on these SIP trunks.

Click the Advanced tab. The Advanced Incoming Call Configuration page opens. To program Direct Inward Dialing (DID)/Direct Dialing Inwards to a range of directory numbers:
In the Number of digits to absorb, enter the number of leading digits to remove from the incoming DID number. For example, to remove the entire DID number 613 592 5661, enter 10. Note that Dial-in trunks used as incoming trunks must always have an entry in the Absorb column. (You must enter "0" if no digits are to be absorbed. If you leave this field as Blank, calls will fail).
In the Digits to insert, enter the actual digits to insert as leading digits to form a directory number (for example, 3333). The maximum number of digits is 4. The Digit Modification columns are left blank if the trunk is outgoing only. If a Dial-In trunk does not require digit modification, enter "0" in the Absorb field and leave the Insert field blank. Note that the Extension field and the DID Digit Modification fields are mutually exclusive. If one option is completed, the other must be left blank.
